titleStmt.title: The whole booke of psalms, collected into English meter by Thomas Sternhold, I. Hopkins and others: co[n]ferred with the Hebrue, with apt notes to syng them withall. Faithfully perused and allowed accordyng to the Quenes Maiesties Injunctions. very meete to be vsed of al sortes of people priuately for their solace & comfort: laying apart al vngodly songes and ballades, which read only to the norishing of vice & corrupting of youth..
Whole book of psalms. 1565
titleStmt.author: Sternhold, Thomas, d. 1549.

titleStmt.title: The whole booke of psalms, collected into English meter by Thomas Sternhold, I. Hopkins and others: co[n]ferred with the Hebrue, with apt notes to syng them withall. Faithfully perused and allowed accordyng to the Quenes Maiesties Injunctions. very meete to be vsed of al sortes of people priuately for their solace & comfort: laying apart al vngodly songes and ballades, which read only to the norishing of vice & corrupting of youth..
Whole book of psalms. 1565
titleStmt.author: Sternhold, Thomas, d. 1549.
Hopkins, John, d. 1570.

notesStmt.note: Imprint at colophon reads: Imprinted at London by Iohn Day, dwellyng ouer Aldersgate, beneath Saint Martins.
At foot of t.p.: "Cum gratia & priuilegio, regie Maiestatis perseptennium."
1 col., B.L., A-S6; series 2/40. Cf. STC (2nd ed.).
Title within ornamental border (McK. & Ferg. 76), printer's device on t.p. verso (McK. 115), tailpiece, initials, printed marginalia.
Reproduction of original in: University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. Library (1653:4) and British Library (2296:1b)

Copy at reel 2296:1b bound and filmed with STC 16296: The booke of common prayer, and administration of the sacramentes, and ceremonies in the Churche of Englande. Imprinted at London : in Powles Churchyarde, by Rycharde Iugge and Iohn Cawood: Printers to the Quenes Maiestie., [1564].
